creditline: Gift of Alfred and Ingrid Lenz Harrison
description: 6 monkeys: adult and baby at L; pair wrestling at center; walking and seated monkeys at R
inscription: 明治十年夏七月 {Meiji jūnen natsu shichigatsu}
markings: two red seals: 橘公粛印 {Tachibana Kōshuku in}, 橘子容氏
signed: 寛斎森公粛写 {Kansai Mori Kōshuku sha}
text: Painted by Mori Kansai, the grandson of the famous monkey painter Mori Sosen (1747–1821), this painting picks up the same subject but Kansai's approach was much looser and more spontaneous. Painted in summer 1887, he used a wide, flat brush and did not render the hair as fine and meticulous as his grandfather did.
title: Monkeys
